Koliko bo medalj?
05 Nov 2019, 14:23 by Simon Maljevac

Turški Mersin je te dni prestolnica svetovnega balinanja. Potem ko so nastope na svetovnem pokalu sklenile balinarke, se bodo od danes do sobote za svetovne naslove potegovali balinarji, med katerimi visoko ciljajo tudi Slovenci.



Anže Petrič, svetovni prvak v brzincu iz Maroka, bo v Turčiji kolajno lovil v štafetnem zbijanju. 

MERSIN > Novembrsko moško svetovno prvenstvo ponuja slovenskemu balinanju lepo priložnost, da obogati svojo zbirko odličij z največjih tekmovanj, ki je že pred časom presegla številko 200. Po zaslugi odličnih nastopov na lanskem evropskem prvenstvu se Slovenci v Turčiji podajajo v lov za odličja v vseh šestih disciplinah. V konkurenci tekmecev iz 23 držav iz Evrope, Azije, Oceanije, Južne Amerike in Afrike naloga nikakor ne bo lahka, čeprav so zaradi trenj znotraj svoje nacionalne zveze nastop odpovedali Francozi.
Slovenci so blesteli na zadnjem svetovnem prvenstvu leta 2017 v Maroku, ko so kot najuspešnejša reprezentanca osvojili tri zlate medalje ter še srebrno in dve bronasti. Davor Janžič bo v Mersinu branil naslov svetovnega prvaka v natančnem zbijanju ter z Juretom Kozjekom tudi v igri dvojic. Slednji je po treh zaporednih svetovnih naslovih v igri posameznikov v Casablanci osvojil bron, srebra pa se je v igri v krog veselil Dejan Tonejc. Ob odsotnosti poškodovanega Aleša Borčnika je na severu Afrike v hitrostnem zbijanju zablestel Anže Petrič in oblekel mavrično majico svetovnega prvaka, medtem ko je štafeta Anže Petrič-Gregor Oprešnik osvojila bron.
Slovenska reprezentanca v MersinuAnton Kosar (selektor), Davor Janžič (dvojica in natančno zbijanje), Jure Kozjek (dvojica in posamezno), Aleš Borčnik (hitrostno in štafetno zbijanje), Anže Petrič (štafetno zbijanje), Dejan Tonejc (igra v krog), Rok Mihič (maser).
Novinec v vlogi članskega selektorja Anton Kosar je prepričan, da lahko njegovi varovanci napadejo najvišja mesta v vseh disciplinah: “Zasedbe v primerjavi z večino zadnjih velikih tekmovanj nisem spreminjal. Verjamem, da si vsi želijo najžlahtnejših odličij. Fantje so na treningih potrdili dobro pripravljenost in lahko smo optimistični.” Tudi tokrat bo edini Primorec v izbrani vrsti Anže Petrič, ki je še pravočasno okreval po operativnem posegu, a vendarle ne bo branil mavrične majice v brzincu. V tej disciplini bo slovenske barve branil Borčnik. Balinar iz Gradišča pri Vipavi bo tako vse moči usmeril v čim boljši nastop v štafetnem zbijanju, v katerem sta svetovni vrh z Borčnikom zasedla leta 2011: “Imel sem dovolj časa za treninge, a kondicijsko še nisem na najvišji ravni. Zaradi tega sem se nastopu v hitrostnem zbijanju vnaprej odpovedal, v štafeti pa je vendarle malce laže. Pred dvema letoma sem izkoristil priložnost, ki se mi je ponudila ob Borčnikovi odsotnosti. Upam, da bo Aleš nadaljeval po tej poti. Že vrsto let nastopava v štafetnem zbijanju v reprezentanci in uigranost ne bi smela biti težava. Skušala bova poseči čim više. Konkurenca je vse močnejša in vse več držav se lahko vmeša v boj za medalje.”
Predsednik Balinarske zveze Slovenije Primož Marinko je pojasnil, da varnostne razmere v mestu ob Sredozemskem morju zaradi napetih razmer v Siriji niso vprašljive. Tekmovalni spored bo v Mersinu pričenja danes dopoldne, finala v vseh šestih disciplinah pa bodo v soboto.


Anže Petrič, svetovni prvak v brzincu iz Maroka, bo v Turčiji kolajno lovil v štafetnem zbijanju.

How many medals will it be?
05 Nov 2019, 14:23 by Simon Maljevac

The Turkish Mersin is the capital of world bowling these days. After the World Cup finals have been made by the bowlers, bowlers will compete for the world titles from today until Saturday, among which the Slovenes are highly targeted.



Anze Petric, the world speed champion from Morocco, will race in Turkey in the relay race.

MERSIN> November Men's World Championship offers a great opportunity for Slovenian bowling to enrich their collection of awards from the biggest competitions, which exceeded the number of 200 years ago. Thanks to excellent performances at last year's European Championships, Slovenes in Turkey go hunting for medals in all six disciplines. In the competition of competitors from 23 countries from Europe, Asia, Oceania, South America and Africa, the task will not be easy, although due to friction within their national federation, the appearance was canceled by the French.
The Slovenians shined at the last World Cup in Morocco in 2017, winning three gold medals and another silver and two bronze medals as their most successful team. In Mersin, Davor Janzic will defend the title of World Champion in precision compacting, as well as with Jure Kozjak in the doubles game. The latter won bronze after winning three consecutive world titles in the Casablanca individual game, while Dejan Tonejc enjoyed silver in the round. In the absence of the injured Ales Borcnik, Anze Petric sparkled in the fast pace of North Africa and donned a rainbow World Champion shirt, while the Anze Petrich-Gregor Opreshnik relay won bronze.
Slovenian national team in MersinAnton Kosar (selector), Davor Janžič (doubles and precision), Jure Kozjek (doubles and singles), Aleš Borčnik (speed and relay), Anže Petrič (relay), Dejan Tonejc (circle play), Rok Mihic (masseur).
Newcomer in the role of member selector Anton Kosar is convinced that his guards can attack the highest places in all disciplines: I believe everyone wants the noblest of awards. The boys confirmed their good preparedness at the training and we can be optimistic. ”Again, the only Primorec in the selected line will be Anže Petrič, who has recovered in time after surgery, but will not defend the rainbow jersey in speed. Borčnik will defend the Slovenian colors in this discipline. A balinar from Gradište near Vipava will thus direct all efforts to the best possible performance in the relay race, in which the world summit with Borčnik took place in 2011: Because of this, I canceled my speed bump in advance, but it is a bit easier in the relay. Two years ago, I took advantage of the opportunity offered to me in the absence of Borčnik. I hope that Ales will continue along this path. He has been in the national relay race for many years, and teamwork should not be a problem. We will try to reach as much as possible. Competition is increasing and more and more countries can get involved in the fight for medals. ”
The President of the Balinese Association of Slovenia, Primoz Marinko, explained that the security situation in the city along the Mediterranean is not questionable due to the tense situation in Syria. The competition schedule will start in Mersin this morning and the finals in all six disciplines will be on Saturday.


Anze Petric, the world speed champion from Morocco, will race in Turkey in the relay race.
